What are simple token currencies in Verus, and what are their characteristics?

Simple token currencies in Verus are currencies without reserves. They can be either decentralized, with a static supply, or centralized, where the owner of the rootID can mint new tokens and anyone can burn them. These currencies can support various use cases, including being mapped to Ethereum ERC-20s, and can be used as reserves in basket currencies.

How does the Verus-Ethereum Bridge work, and what are its benefits?

The Verus-Ethereum Bridge is a non-custodial bridge that allows currencies and tokens to be sent between Verus and Ethereum. It ensures that tokens and currencies are never in anyone's custody and are proven and verified by consensus rules. This bridge enables the export of any Verus currency or token to Ethereum as an ERC-20, and also allows existing ERC-20 tokens to be mapped one-to-one as Verus currencies, taking advantage of Verus' L1 features.
